text:
He had known it all and understood everything. It was like it had been decided yesterday when he was pulling those jewel cases out of the box. Yeah, that’s how it was.

“I’m just really sick,” he thought grimly. “I’ve been stressing way too much, and I don’t even know what I’m doing anymore. I’ll get better and stop worrying. But what if I don’t get better? Ugh, I’m so over this!” 

He kept walking, restless. He craved distraction but had no clue what to do. A new feeling was taking over him—an intense, almost physical disgust for everything around him. He felt a strong, stubborn hatred. Everyone he saw was gross to him; he hated their faces, their movements, everything. If someone talked to him, he felt like he might just spit at them or bite them. 😤

Then he suddenly stopped by the Little Neva, near the bridge to Vassilyevsky Ostrov. “Wait, he lives in that house,” he thought. “I didn’t come to Razumihin on purpose! Is this déjà vu or what? Well, I said I’d visit him, so I guess I will. Plus, I can’t really go any further now.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with intense illness and overwhelming feelings of hatred towards his surroundings while contemplating a visit to a friend.
